definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess

sentences.english: Mr. Munson spat on one of the windows.
sentences.chinese: 老李随即啐了一口吐沫在酒吧的一扇窗户上。

sentences.english: She spat the words at him as if they hurt her.
sentences.chinese: 她生气地啐出这几个字，似乎受到它们的伤害。

sentences.english: Willie looked at him and spat over the side.
sentences.chinese: 威利看了他一眼，朝身旁啐了一口。

sentences.english: He spat in the man's face.
It's like spitting in the face of god herself.
sentences.chinese: 就像上帝往自己的脸上啐了一口。

sentences.english: I take out my artificial eye, spit on it and polish it with my handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 我取下假眼，朝上面啐口唾沫，用手帕擦拭了一番。

sentences.english: Oh, ask me why, and I'll spit in your eye.
sentences.chinese: 噢，问我为什么，我只能啐在你的眼睛里。
阿不福思朝火里啐了一口。
托德向休啐了一口唾沫。

sentences.english: Squeeze sip of water after the silk string of empty fruit.
sentences.chinese: 挤压水分后啐丝的空果串。

definition: to deride/to mock/(jocularly) to heckle good-naturedly/to razz
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to cast sidelong glances at sb
